intro: Dicraeia imbricata, commonly known as the Mexican flame tree, is a species of flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It is a member of the Bignoniaceae family and is characterized by its showy, orange-red flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has compound leaves with opposite arrangement and produces fruit that splits open to release its seeds. It is often cultivated as an ornamental tree due to its striking foliage and vibrant floral display. Dicraeia imbricata thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is adaptable to various soil types.
